description: Borrowed from French marionnette. The word originally meant a small statue of the Virgin Mary, then also a puppet of her used in religious theatrical presentations, finally generalised to any puppet.

entries.meaning: A puppet, usually made of wood, which is animated by the pulling of strings.

verbs.description: marionette (third-person singular simple present marionettes, present participle marionetting, simple past and past participle marionetted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To control (somebody) as if they were a puppet; to manipulate.
